channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Stephen Bartholomeusz
item.description: The Federal Reserve Board meets this week to decide the course of US monetary policy amid economic and political uncertainty.
item.title: Is the Fed about to signal the start of the tapering of its bond purchases?

item.dc:creator: Saman Shad
item.description: Before lockdown, it would not have occurred to me that people would take photos of strangers so they could put them on social media to criticise them.
item.title: Public shaming of supposed lockdown criminals has got to stop

item.dc:creator: Jack Latimore
item.description: Here’s the sequel to our guide to the dynamic and fast-changing Blak, Black, Blackfulla lexicon.
item.title: A New Hope: Invoking The Force to talk about Blackfulla stuff

item.dc:creator: Andrew Webster
item.description: Rugby league’s unhealthy obsession with match officials has become predictable and boring.
item.title: The referees will always be in crisis — but let’s stop moaning about them

item.dc:creator: Broede Carmody
item.description: Victorian government modelling suggests the state’s hospital system could be overwhelmed in the coming months, people in 12 Sydney LGAs are waking up to greater freedoms and former attorney-general Christian Porter has resigned from federal cabinet.
item.title: Australia news LIVE: NSW records 935 new local COVID-19 cases; four deaths as outdoor restrictions eased in south-west Sydney; Victoria records 567 new cases, state’s road map sparks concerns

item.description: The United Russia party is expected to maintain its grip over the lower house, with opposition parties and independent observers claiming widespread fraud.
item.title: ‘Ballot stuffing’: Putin’s party wins election but loses some ground

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: NSW has reported 935 new local coronavirus cases on Monday, its lowest daily case figure since late August.
item.title: NSW records 935 new cases of COVID-19, four deaths

item.description: Crews searching a US national park for missing Gabby Petito found a body “consistent” with the 22-year-old woman in a remote area but have not yet made a formal identification, the FBI says.
item.title: Police find body ‘consistent with’ Gabby Petito in Wyoming

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: More than 50,000 Queenslanders rolled up their sleeves at walk-in hubs for the “Pfizer weekend” acceleration of the vaccine rollout.
item.title: Queensland hits 60 per cent for first doses as two COVID cases detected in quarantine

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: Victorian electricity operator AusNet will open its books to the Canadian infrastructure investor, which has returned to the table after two unsuccessful bids in August.
item.title: Brookfield lobs $9.6 billion bid for AusNet

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: A police spokesman said members of the public made the grim discovery at Captain Burke Park.
item.title: Man’s body found in Brisbane River near Story Bridge

item.description: The 73rd Primetime Emmy Awards were in-person again this year, and some of Hollywood’s biggest stars shone on the carpet.
item.title: Emmys 2021: All the looks from the red carpet

item.dc:creator: Tom Decent
item.description: Springboks No.10 Handre Pollard has suggested a ‘street smart’ Wallabies team were using questionable off-the-ball tactics in their 30-17 victory at Suncorp Stadium.
item.title: ‘They get away with it’: Springboks star accuses Wallabies of dodgy tactics

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Webb
item.description: The figures come after Premier Daniel Andrews outlined a significantly slower and more cautious path out of COVID-19 lockdown than NSW.
item.title: Victoria records one death as state’s COVID-19 cases climb to record number for 2021

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: Mobile advertising startup Unlockd has brought legal proceedings in the United States against Google claiming it collapsed because of the tech giant’s anti-competitive behaviour.
item.title: ‘So much for don’t be evil’: Aussie startup Unlockd sues Google in the US

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: The Rabbitohs recruit was arrested after police were called to Marshall Street in Brisbane’s Fortitude Valley following reports of a disturbance.
item.title: Milford to face court after being charged with assault

item.dc:creator: Alice Clarke
item.description: Even if you’re not looking for a new iPhone this week, the one you already have is due for some updates.
item.title: The new iPhone features coming to your pocket in iOS 15

item.description: The former Black Caps star spoke for the first time since the spinal stroke during surgery that left him paralysed in the legs in August.
item.title: ‘Possibly the greatest challenge I’ve faced’: Cairns ready for rehab after stroke

item.dc:creator: Damien Woolnough
item.description: The critically acclaimed series have split the early awards on TV’s big night, after the stars of Netflix’s royal drama turned heads on the red carpet.
item.title: Emmys 2021 LIVE updates: Ted Lasso, The Crown claim early wins

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 20, 2021

item.description: A triumph of casting and technology, the anthology drama Fires is “an enormous story in our nation’s history”, says executive producer Andrea Denholm.
item.title: Landmark ABC drama Fires is a story of loss and heroism

item.dc:creator: Ben Pobjie
item.description: It’s 50 years since Young Talent Time launched on Australian TV; on the eve of a commemorative special, host Johnny Young reminiscences on the show’s humble beginnings.
item.title: Forever young: Young Talent Time marks a milestone

item.dc:creator: Emma Koehn
item.description: The ASX dropped 1.3%, down 37.6 points to 7366.1 as Fortescue and BHP dropped on lower iron ore prices. Ausnet jumped 20% following a $9.5b bid.
item.title: ASX drops 1.3%, AusNet soars on $9.6b bid, Transurban grabs WestConnex

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: A consortium led by toll road giant Transurban will take full control of Sydney’s WestConnex after winning the NSW government’s auction of its 49 per cent stake in Australia’s largest toll road project.
item.title: Transurban takes full control of WestConnex in $11 billion deal

item.dc:creator: Daniella White
item.description: Smoke lingered on Monday morning due to hazard reduction burns being conducted around Sydney’s fringe.
item.title: Hazard reduction burns cause poor air quality in parts of Sydney

item.description: Filipino boxing legend Manny Pacquiao has announced he was running for president in next year’s elections, potentially facing off with incumbent state leader Rodrigo Duterte’s chosen successor.
item.title: Boxing superstar Manny Pacquiao announces run for Philippines president

item.dc:creator: Daniella White
item.description: Police believe last year’s the shootings of underworld figures Mejid Hamzy, 44, and Fares Abounader, 39, may be connected and have released footage linked to their deaths.
item.title: Blond man seen fleeing the scene of underworld murder

item.description: A volcano has erupted on La Palma in the Spanish Canary Islands, sending jets of lava and a plume of smoke and ash into the air.
item.title: La Palma volcano erupts in the Canary Islands, forcing evacuations

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Monday, September 20

item.dc:creator: Peter Milne
item.description: Andrew Forrest’s green hydrogen team has thrown out the HR rule book to attract talent in its quest to decarbonise the economy.
item.title: Twiggy’s climate quest draws on ‘Netflix culture’ for a workplace with no bosses

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: “I’m devastated - I love my job, I don’t want to lose my job, I will fight it. If I do lose my job, we will lose the house, the car, private education for our children - we will lose everything.”
item.title: Perth nurse willing to ‘lose everything’ to evade WA government vaccine mandate

item.dc:creator: Peter de Kruijff
item.description: Melbourne-founded fast food franchise Lord of the Fries is being sued in the WA Supreme Court over a claim of unpaid rent and vacating a lease two years early.
item.title: Vegan fry franchise sued for almost $1m after leaving Perth CBD shopfront

item.dc:creator: Sarah Berry
item.description: Meditation apps can teach us a skill that takes us well beyond life in lockdown. We reviewed six of the most popular on the market.
item.title: We tried six meditation apps. This is what we thought

item.description: Now with more gray than dark brown in his stubble, the 41-year-old Spaniard sets off for his 10th Ryder Cup at Whistling Straits to extend a remarkable run.
item.title: ‘Sergio loves the Ryder Cup’: All you need to know about golf’s most intense show

item.dc:creator: Samantha Hutchinson
item.description: It’s a case of will-they, won’t-they for Sydney’s golf clubs after a swag of Victorian golf clubs mandate jabs at courses
item.title: Sydney golfers in limbo on ‘no jab, no play’

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce said international travel was getting closer as vaccination rates rise, but the extra money is a sign the industry will need help for longer than planned.
item.title: $183m in government funding to extend aviation support until March

item.dc:creator: Daniel Cherny
item.description: Proud of what his former club and teammates have achieved, Liam Jurrah admits Melbourne’s grand final berth leaves feelings of regret for what might have been.
item.title: ‘I regret it’: Jurrah’s mixed feelings ahead of Dees’ grand final

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: After Saturday’s violence and similar clashes at a demonstration on August 21, Victoria’s police chief has flagged the use of specialised riot officers at anti-lockdown rallies.
item.title: Riot police set for front line at future COVID protests

item.dc:creator: Royce Millar
item.description: Some of Victoria’s most marginalised citizens are caught up in a dispute as rival disability accommodation and support businesses fight for the right to access their funding packages under the NDIS.
item.title: Ugly turf war as service providers tussle over NDIS clients with disabilities

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Penrith get the finals shot at Melbourne they so badly wanted but after two weeks of play-offs, it’s clear the Storm are a cut above those chasing their crown.
item.title: As the NRL race narrows, who can beat the Melbourne Storm?

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: Brett Sheehy, who steps down this month as artistic director, wants the government to pass a law so theatre staff and audiences must be vaccinated.
item.title: Departing MTC director calls for mandatory theatre jabs

item.dc:creator: Michael Evans
item.description: An eight-year investigation into major drug importations climaxed with the extradition of two men from Dubai last week. But investigators raised questions about organised crime infiltrating authorities.
item.title: Sparky and Gangster: inside the rise and fall of a major drug syndicate

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: A four-way battle is looming for the broadcast rights to the English Premier League, which could fetch up to $240 million.
item.title: Blind auction for English Premier League rights could reshape Aussie streaming landscape

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: New research shows up to 70 per cent of households in suburban electorates are under mortgage financial stress as high house prices eat into the weekly budget.
item.title: Mortgage stress soars as RBA says tax system pushes up house prices

item.dc:creator: Emma Dawson
item.description: A shallow understanding of identity politics among many on the Left is a significant threat to progressive politics.
item.title: Left’s identity politics crisis a progressive problem

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cave
item.description: The real potential of AUKUS lies in how the new grouping can be leveraged in the long term to help Australia deal with the profound technological disruption about to sweep the world.
item.title: Australia well placed to turbocharge its strategic tech capability

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: Thousands of laptops have been sent to homes in Sydney’s hotspots as students face home schooling hurdles.
item.title: Demand for loan laptops another signal of a city divided by COVID

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: The number of people living with dementia - the biggest killer of women in Australia - will double by 2058, putting pressure on budgets and carers.
item.title: ‘It doesn’t mean I’m stupid’: Dementia rates set to double

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The plans for an area next to the new football stadium clear the way for a permanent end to the parking of vehicles on fields at Moore Park during events.
item.title: ‘Village precinct’ at Moore Park signals end to on-grass parking

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: The Maritime Union of Australia is being investigated by the industry watchdog after a whistleblower complaint raised concerns about improper selling of union cars.
item.title: Maritime Union probed over selling union cars to friends, family
